issues.description: The problem statement explicitly says the endpoint GET /persons returns a Set of all persons, but both the template and solution implementation declare and return a List<Person> from the REST endpoint and service (PersonResource.getAllPersons returns ResponseEntity<List<Person>> and PersonService.getAll returns List<Person>). This is a cross-artifact type mismatch for the collection type returned by the GET /persons endpoint and may confuse students about the expected return type and how to implement/consume the endpoint.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the wording in the problem statement match the code: either change the problem text to state that GET /persons returns a List of persons (List<Person>) or change the template and solution signatures to return a Set<Person> consistently. The simpler fix is to update the problem statement to refer to a List<Person>, since the template and solution already use List. Ensure any example code/snippets in the statement and tests reflect the chosen collection type.
